Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.daveho.funwithsound.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Play a composition.

      • setCustomInstrumentFactory

        public void setCustomInstrumentFactory(CustomInstrumentFactory customInstrumentFactory)
        Set the CustomInstrumentFactory to use for creating the runtime support for custom instruments.
        Parameters:
        customInstrumentFactory - the CustomInstrumentFactory to set

      • setStartDelayUs

        public void setStartDelayUs(long startDelayUs)
        Set the start delay (in microseconds).
        Parameters:
        startDelayUs - the start delay (in microseconds)

      • setIdleWaitUs

        public void setIdleWaitUs(long idleWaitUs)
        Set the idle wait time (in microseconds). This is the time between the last note off event and shutting down the AudioContext.
        Parameters:
        idleWaitUs - the idle wait time (in microseconds)

      • getCurrentTimestamp

        public long getCurrentTimestamp()
        Get the current timestamp in microseconds from the AudioContext.
        Returns:
        the current timestamp in microseconds

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Check whether the player is playing asynchronously.
        Returns:
        true if the player is playing, false if not

      • setComposition

        public void setComposition(Composition composition)
        Set the Composition to play.
        Parameters:
        composition - the Composition to play.

      • setNoteEventCallback

        public void setNoteEventCallback(NoteEventCallback noteEventCallback)
        Set a NoteEventCallback. The callback's NoteEventCallback.onNoteEvent(NoteEvent) method will be called (approximately) when NoteEvents occur. Be aware that the callback will occur in the context of the AudioContext thread.
        Parameters:
        noteEventCallback - the NoteEventCallback to set

      • play

        public void play()
          throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Play the composition synchronously.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if a MIDI synthesizer and/or receiver can't be found
        java.io.IOException - if a soundfont can't be loaded

      • startPlaying

        public void startPlaying()
        Start playing the composition asynchronously.

      • checkForEndOfPlaying

        public void checkForEndOfPlaying()
        Check whether asynchronous playing has ended.

      • forceStopPlaying

        public void forceStopPlaying()
        Force asynchronous playing to stop.

      • saveWaveFile

        public void saveWaveFile(java.lang.String outputFile)
                  throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Save the rendered composition as a wave file.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - the name of the wave file to write
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if a MIDI synthesizer and/or receiver can't be found
        java.io.IOException - if a soundfont can't be loaded

      • getReceiver

        public javax.sound.midi.Receiver getReceiver()
        Get the Receiver that will deliver MIDI messages to the Gervill instance being used to play the live audition part.
        Returns:
        the Receiver, or null if there is no live audition part
